articles.author: Hira Humayun, Jason Hanna and Rebekah Riess, CNN
articles.title: Deaths of 3 Americans at Sandals resort in the Bahamas are under investigation, officials say - CNN
articles.description: Three Americans died of unknown causes Friday at a Sandals resort on the Bahamas' Great Exuma island, and police are investigating, officials said.

articles.title: Helicopter catches space rocket booster - The Mercury
articles.description:
The American-New Zealand company Rocket Lab has taken a big step forward in its quest to reuse its launch vehicles – by catching one – as it fell back to Earth.

A helicopter grabbed the booster mid-air as it parachuted back towards the Pacific Ocean.

articles.title: Indian American among 4 SpaceX astronauts to return home after 6 months - The Federal
articles.description: Indian American Raja Chari was among the four astronauts SpaceX brought home with a midnight splashdown in the Gulf of Mexico on Friday (May 6), capping the busiest stretch yet for Elon Musk’s taxi service.

articles.author: RFE/RL
articles.title: Chelsea Soccer Club Sold To U.S.-Led Investors, Ending Ownership By Russian Oligarch Abramovich - Radio Free Europe / Radio Liberty
articles.description: The British soccer club Chelsea will be sold to a group of investors led by an American billionaire, formally ending nearly two decades of ownership by Kremlin-connected oligarch Roman Abramovich.

articles.title: Anglo's 'impossible' hydrogen-powered trucks could soon go commercial | Fin24 - News24
articles.description: Anglo American will begin rolling out its hydrogen-powered trucks in 2025.
articles.content:
Mining giant Anglo American is weighing its options on how to commercialise its hydrogen haul truck, the largest of its kind, in the world.
